qas.question: What type of crop was rice considered to be during this period?
What were dogs in this era most likely to be considered?
What type of partridge was commonly consumed?
What was the color of the bayberries?

context: The most common <a0_0>staple crops<a0_0/> consumed during Han were wheat, barley, foxtail millet, proso millet, rice, and beans. Commonly eaten fruits and vegetables included chestnuts, pears, plums, peaches, melons, apricots, strawberries, <a4_0>red<a4_0/> bayberries, jujubes, calabash, bamboo shoots, mustard plant and taro. Domesticated animals that were also eaten included chickens, Mandarin ducks, geese, cows, sheep, pigs, camels and dogs (various types were bred specifically for food, while most were used as <a1_0>pets<a1_0/>). Turtles and fish were taken from <a3_0>streams and lakes<a3_0/>. Commonly hunted game, such as owl, pheasant, magpie, sika deer, and <a2_0>Chinese bamboo<a2_0/> partridge were consumed. Seasonings included sugar, honey, salt and soy sauce. Beer and wine were regularly consumed.
